data.title: The Indianapolis Star
data.meta_description: Former Marion star gets his wish, will stay in Memphis
data.text:
Zach Randolph gets new deal with Memphis Grizzlies

Zach Randolph, who has said repeatedly he wants to stay with the Memphis Grizzlies, got his wish.

According to a person familiar with the deal, Randolph, a star at Marion High School, has agreed to exercise his player option for $16.5 million for next season and will receive a two-year, $20 million extension for the following two seasons.

The person spoke to USA TODAY Sports on the condition of anonymity because of the private nature of contract talks.

Last season, Randolph averaged 17.4 points and 10.1 rebounds (18.2 and 8.7 in the playoffs).
